sections.heading: What is の Nominalization?
sections.content:
の nominalization turns verbs, adjectives, and entire clauses into noun phrases by adding の after the plain form. This is like adding "-ing" in English (e.g., "reading is fun"). The の acts as a placeholder noun meaning "the act of" or "the thing of."

読むのが好き "I like reading" (Lit: I like the act of reading) 早く寝るのは大切だ "Sleeping early is important" 彼が来たのを知っている "I know that he came"

children.heading: [Plain form] + の
children.content: 食べる + の → 食べるの "Eating / to eat" 難しい + の → 難しいの "Being difficult / the difficult thing" Turns verb/adjective into noun

children.heading: Functions as a noun
children.content: 読むのが好き "Reading is liked (by me)" の acts as subject/object

children.heading: Subject of sentence
children.content: 走るのは楽しい "Running is fun" 日本語を勉強するのは難しい "Studying Japanese is difficult" の as subject

children.heading: Object of verb
children.content: 泳ぐのが好き "I like swimming" 料理するのを忘れた "I forgot to cook" の as object

children.heading: After adjectives
children.content: 遅いのが嫌いだ "I hate being late" 高いのは買わない "I don't buy expensive things" Nominalizes adjectives

sections.heading: の with が and を

children.heading: が for likes/dislikes/abilities
children.content: 泳ぐのが好き "I like swimming" 走るのが得意 "I'm good at running" 歌うのが下手 "I'm bad at singing" が with ability/preference

children.heading: を for other verbs
children.content: 勉強するのを忘れた "I forgot to study" 行くのをやめた "I stopped going" 見るのを楽しむ "Enjoy watching" を with action verbs

children.heading: 〜のが好き/嫌い
children.content: 読むのが好き "I like reading" 待つのが嫌い "I hate waiting" Expressing preferences

children.heading: 〜のは〜だ
children.content: 大切なのは努力だ "What's important is effort" 問題なのは時間だ "The problem is time" Emphasis structure

children.heading: 〜のを見る/聞く
children.content: 彼が走るのを見た "I saw him running" 音楽を聴くのが好き "I like listening to music" Perception verbs

children.heading: Beginning (as subject)
children.content: 食べるのは楽しい "Eating is fun" Topic position

children.heading: Middle (as object)
children.content: 私は泳ぐのが好きです "I like swimming" Object position

children.heading: の itself is neutral
children.content: Casual: 読むのが好きだ "I like reading" Polite: 読むのが好きです "I like reading" Politeness in final verb

children.heading: の more conversational
children.content: 泳ぐのが好き "I like swimming" Casual, spoken

children.heading: こと more formal/written
children.content: 泳ぐことが好き "I like swimming" Formal, written

children.heading: Sometimes interchangeable
children.content: 勉強するのは大切だ 勉強することは大切だ "Studying is important" Both acceptable

children.heading: の as "one"
children.content: 赤いの "The red one" 大きいの "The big one" 新しいのがいい "I want a new one" Replaces obvious noun

children.heading: Talking about hobbies
children.content: 読むのが好き "I like reading" 料理するのが楽しい "Cooking is fun" Personal interests

children.heading: Expressing abilities
children.content: 泳ぐのが得意 "I'm good at swimming" 歌うのが上手 "I'm good at singing" Skill descriptions

children.heading: Making statements
children.content: 早く起きるのは難しい "Waking up early is difficult" 日本語を話すのは楽しい "Speaking Japanese is fun" General statements

children.heading: い-adjectives (plain)
children.content: 赤いの "The red one" 新しいの "The new one" Direct modification

children.heading: な-adjectives (with な)
children.content: 静かなの "The quiet one" 便利なの "The convenient one" な connects

children.heading: Present/future
children.content: 行くのが好き "I like going" 食べるのを忘れた "I forgot to eat" Dictionary form + の

children.heading: Past
children.content: 行ったのを覚えている "I remember going" 食べたのを後悔した "I regretted eating" Past form + の

children.heading: Verb negative
children.content: 行かないのがいい "Not going is better" 食べないのは悪い "Not eating is bad" ない-form + の

children.heading: Using です before の
children.content: Wrong: 好きですのは ⚠️ Correct: 好きなのは ✓ For な-adjectives, use な before の

children.heading: Confusing の positions
children.content: Wrong: のが好き泳ぐ ⚠️ Correct: 泳ぐのが好き ✓ "I like swimming" の comes after verb

children.heading: Using を with 好き
children.content: Wrong: 泳ぐのを好き ⚠️ Correct: 泳ぐのが好き ✓ 好き/嫌い use が

children.heading: 〜のだ/んだ (explanatory)
children.content: 雨が降っているのだ "It's raining (you see)" 知らなかったんだ "I didn't know (I'm telling you)" Explanatory tone Different from nominalization

children.heading: Asking about activities
children.content: 何をするのが好き？ "What do you like doing?" どこに行くのがいい？ "Where is it good to go?" Activity preferences

children.heading: Turning actions into things
children.content: 考えるのは人間だけだ "Only humans think" (Lit: Thinking is only humans) 学ぶのに遅すぎることはない "It's never too late to learn" Abstract nominalization

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 泳ぐのが好き "I like swimming" 読むのは楽しい "Reading is fun" 早く起きるのは難しい "Waking up early is difficult" 赤いのがいい "I want the red one" 静かなのが好き "I like quiet ones"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 日本語を勉強するのは楽しいですが、難しいです "Studying Japanese is fun, but difficult" 料理を作るのが得意な人を探しています "I'm looking for someone who is good at cooking" 彼が来るのを待っている "I'm waiting for him to come" 毎日運動するのは健康にいい "Exercising every day is good for health" 朝早く起きるのを忘れないでください "Please don't forget to wake up early in the morning"
